prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load required packages
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", sheet = 1, col_names = TRUE)

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")

# Create DESeq2 object
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = count_table[, -1],
                              colData = annotation_data,
                              design = ~ group)

# Perform statistical tests
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Get gene-specific results for each group
results <- lapply(unique(annotation_data$group), function(group) {
  res <- results(dds, contrast = c("group", group, "control"))
  res <- res[which(res$padj < 0.05), ]
  res$group <- group
  res
})

# Combine the results into a single data frame
results <- do.call(rbind, results)

# Plot PCA using group-specific genes
pca_data <- t(count_table[results$rownames, -1])
pca <- prcomp(pca_data)
pca_df <- as.data.frame(pca$x)
pca_df$group <- annotation_data$group[results$rownames]

pca_plot <- ggplot(pca_df, aes(PC1, PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  theme_minimal()

pca_plot
